main event: On March 31, 1967, a civilian observer in Bayshore, Long Island, New York, reported seeing a yellowish-orange object in the sky that resembled a hamburger.
interesting points: The observer initially thought the object was a bright star until noticing its movement,Two daughters of the observer also witnessed the object and described a dark band around it,The object emitted no sound during the observation, The object appeared to dim and then suddenly re-brighten before fading out completely, The report included a reference to similar sightings identified as hot air balloons.
sighted object: a yellowish-orange object resembling a hamburger
witness description: a civilian observer and two daughters aged 11 and 8
